etymologies: Middle English: via Latin from Greek huaina, feminine of hus ‘pig’ (the transference of the term probably being because the animal's mane was thought to resemble a hog's bristles)

definitions: a doglike African mammal with forelimbs that are longer than the hind limbs and an erect mane. Hyenas are noted as scavengers but most are also effective hunters.

notes.text: Family Hyaenidae: two genera, in particular Hyaena, and three species

shortDefinitions: doglike African mammal with forelimbs that are longer than hindlimbs
